article.headline: Rutgers 74, West Virginia 53
article.story: PISCATAWAY, N.J. (AP)-- Ricky Shields tied a career high with 24 points and Rutgers used a late first-half surge to take control en route to a 74-53 victory over West Virginia Wednesday night. In bouncing back from Sunday's 32-point loss at Boston College, Rutgers (16-9, 7-7) defeated the Mountaineers(14-10, 6-7) for just the third time in the last nine meetings and moved ahead of WVU into a seventh-place tie in the Big East. Rutgers, which is now off until Wednesday, improved to 13-1 at home. Adrian Hill added 11 points for Rutgers, which shot 52.9 percent, while Herve Lamizana had 10 points, five assists, six rebounds and two blocks. Quincy Douby had 10 points and six assists and Juel Wiggan had eight points, six rebounds and five assists. Patrick Beilein led WVU with 16 points while D'or Fischer had 14 points. Trailing 14-9, the Scarlet Knights outscored West Virginia 25-7 over the final 10:12 of the first half. The Mountaineers shot 3-for-17 during that span after making six of their first 11 shots. Shields scored 10 points in a 15-2 run that gave Rutgers a 24-16 advantage. Four of his points came in transition off Lamizana blocks and two came off his own steal and layup. West Virginia closed to within 24-21 before Rutgers scored eight straight over the final 4:25 to open a 13-point halftime lead. The Knights shot 50 percent in the half while WVU hit just 32.1 percent. The Knights continued to build on their lead after intermission, opening their largest advantage at 62-36. At one point, West Virginia made five of six shots but could get no closer than 51-36. Rutgers helped itself by shooting 15-for-17 from the foul line and assisting on 22 of its 27 baskets.
